cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 385 miles SE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest toward the North-South Carolina coastline, then forecast to slow and drift west-southwest inland across South Carolina and into eastern Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Wilmington / Surf City, North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC; Storm Surge Watch from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC and north of Duck NC to NC/VA border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds; Storm Surge Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire South Carolina and North Carolina coasts with expanding effects into coastal Georgia, including the Port of Savannah area
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts are possible (up to 45–55 mph) late Saturday into Sunday at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor inundation of 1–3 ft above ground level cannot be ruled out, but values above 3 ft are not currently expected for Savannah.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands from Florence could bring 3–6 inches of rain with isolated higher totals near the coast, producing localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along Georgia beaches; potential river flooding inland if heavy rain persists.
